roleset.name: like a magazine subscription, or belief system, like a magazine subscription or a belief system
roleset.note: SUBSCRIBE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'subscribe' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No verbnet entry. No comparison. (from subscribe.01-v predicate notes)
SUBSCRIPTION-N NOTES: Based on ontonotes nouns. Comparison to subscribe.01. Framed by Katie. (from subscription.01-n)

example.name: belief system
example.text: Goldman Sachs's Mr. Einhorn, for one, subscribes to that scenario.
example.arg: Goldman Sachs's Mr. Einhorn, for one,

example.name: magazine - like
example.text: a three-month subscription to its pay-movie service

roleset.name: pledge or contribute or sign up(?)
roleset.note: SUBSCRIBE-V NOTES: I don't understand this usage at all--if you figure it out, explain it --to me. (from subscribe.02-v)

example.name: contribute
example.text: [Customers holding contracts for Waertsilae Marine's undelivered ships]-1 are expected *trace*-1 to subscribe most of the remaining 170 million markkaa in share capital, government officials said.
example.arg: most of the remaining 170 million markkaa

example.name: sign up for?
example.text: Canada's largest department store operator said the rights offering will entitle holders of its ordinary shares, except residents in the U.S. and Britain, to subscribe for two additional shares for every five shares held at a price of C$31.25 a share.
example.arg: holders of its ordinary shares, except residents in the U.S. and Britain,
for two additional shares for every five shares held
at a price of C$31.25 a share
